p: Dental caries, one of the most common health problems in the world, is a chronic disease that destroys tooth tissue and that can adversely affect chewing and aesthetic appearance [ 1]. The most important aspect of the formation of dental caries is that in the absence of plaque or fermentable carbohydrates, caries does not occur [ 2]. Many factors, such as cariogenic microflora, fermentable carbohydrates, plaque, and duration, are considered as possible sources for the development of caries [ 3]. Dental caries occurs as a result of the interaction of these factors and host susceptibility, and the acidogenic bacteria often use sucrose as a substrate [ 4].
